intro: Cycnium brachycalyx, commonly known as the short calyx horsehead, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release seeds. Cycnium brachycalyx is often found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
